comment: good professor and very knowledgeable. be prepared to do a lot of reading and have lockdown browser quizzes every week. assignments can typically be completed very quickly. fair grader as long as you do what is asked.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: You won't pass this class unless you watch all the lectures and take notes on every little thing. If you don't pay attention and fully understand, you will NOT pass the weekly quizzes (which are 10 questions in 5 minutes and require webcam+ lockdown browser) on top of the quizzes, we have writing assignments every week to every other week.Goodluck!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Weekly quizzes regularly covered content outside the module. Took 10+ pages of notes for 7 weeks (then dropped) but never scored above 80. Instructor was unhelpful via email and seemed not to care about my issues. Despite 18 pages of midterm notes, I performed very poorly. The course was overwhelming, frustrating, and most of all time-consuming.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Absolutely don't take this dude. Biggest ego I've ever seen on a professor and a VERY tough grader. Lots of assignments
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: DO NOT TAKE HIM! His lectures are incredibly boring and then he expects you to take a quiz/test (webcam) with questions he didn't even go over. Textbook is required but useless. Gives a writing assignment every week in addition to weekly quizzes and accused me of using AI when I didn't. Also takes forever to grade and respond to emails.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: This class was so easy and the professor seemed so nice! The lectures are so easy to follow and the textbook is not super necessary. Every week is the same with lecture videos, a discussion, and maybe some type of assignment that is generally pretty short, they just seem long. Would take again!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Accessible outside class

comment: Don't take him unless you like feeling overwhelmed. I had him for the first three weeks of this semester and then had to wtidrawal because of the course load. I had four other classes and couldn't get through the week by completing 5-time consuming assignments a week.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment:
Class was a hybrid class. In person class was fun and entertaining but online was hell. Test and quiz was online with lockdown (camera). Online lectures were boring and slow. Did more work on the online portion than in person.
  
If you can find a better Professor do it but if not he is not a bad choice.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Gentry is one of my favorite professors/teachers of all time. The workload is very manageable and it will genuinely help you learn the material. Interesting in-class lecturesJust by doing to assigned homework and quizzes, I felt like I learned a lot and was well-prepared for exams. He is a very kind and knowledgeable professor.Take him!!
rating_tags: Group projects--Amazing lectures --Inspirational

comment: Professor Gentry provides a TON of busy work. I spent more time on his online class each week than I did all of my other classes combined. That being said, he is a very lenient grader on the assignments. Quizzes and exams are webcam so be prepared to study. Midterm and final are both written exams on various topics.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: Lots of opportunities for extra credit, he doesn't want to see students fail. Lectures are a bit dull but he seems genuinely interested in history.
rating_tags: Group projects--Caring--Lecture heavy

comment: One lecture in class (take notes or else you won't get it) and separate lectures online with a quiz that opens after you've watched them, due weekly. This class is easy if you can grasp the way he teaches and has a "token" system, basically whoever has the most wins from Kahoot quizzes gets to skip the final entirely. Easy class just apply yourself
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Gentry makes it easy to understand big history concepts. The work load can be heavy and it is a lot of information, but there are no surprises. He will not quiz/test you over something he did not clearly state in his lectures. We have 1 quiz a week, but they consist of only 5 questions. If some part of you enjoys history, take this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: One of the best professors I've had. He is obviously passionate about history, and there is never a lecture about anything uninteresting. He's funny, and relatable, but very clearly a respected professor. It seems like he got my jokes, so that's an automatic plus in my book. There is a lot of reading, so buy the audio books! 10/10 would take again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: This class is only interesting if you have an interest in history. He goes into unnecessary detail about things that he will not test you on. It was extremely unclear what I needed to study and what I didn't. Assignments are extremely easy but quizzes are awful. Avoid if you don't want unnecessary work.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: If you are pursuing a major that is strenuous and you are taking a lot of difficult courses and wanted a filler class that would be easy, this is not the professor for you. He grades easily and his assignments are simple but the time required each week takes time away from more important classes. Most assignments feel like unimportant busy work.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Avoid him at all costs. Assignments don't even teach you anything, just a pile of ambiguous papers with no clear intent or direction. Pick a different teacher, save yourself.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Save yourself, you have other classes to take. This is a professor who doesn't seem to care about that though. Just throws everything he has at you.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Barely bearable, too many discussions and projects. Overwhelming at times. Straight ass! He does give good feedback which I feel does help develop us!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: This Professor seems to forget that we have other classes to take. Im taking his Modern World History course online and my god does it take up more time than my other 4 classes COMBINED! Like how does that make sense?!? Every week we have a project, and 2 very very lengthy discussion posts that also require peer responses. Very textbook oriented!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--So many papers

comment: Jonathan Gentry is an amazing professor. He structures his lectures so you aren't just copying down a bunch of words from the board, but so you can actually listen to what he says. He's clearly very passionate about teaching and makes the information interesting and easy to follow. Because of him I have declared a minor in history!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Gentry is very knowledgeable about European history, and his wealth of knowledge on sources saved my paper on several occasions. His feedback and expectations are clear and helpful. He assigns and quizzes you on readings for the first 10 weeks, but after that all the focus is on the research paper. If you have the chance to take him, do so.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Promotes discussion over the readings assigned, for a time there is weekly reading quizzes but those go away after the first 9ish weeks. Work is difficult but he helps you through it all the way.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Pretty easy class
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Took as a hybrid. Allowed 4 free skips. The midterm and final had study guides that were very helpful. Lots of mini "projects" that were easy and a few quizzes. When you go to class, make sure you talk a few times. Easy class and very nice professor! I would recommend this professor to anyone.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Professor Gentry was honestly a really great professor. Every week I was so excited to go to class because he clearly is very invested into what he's teaching and does a great job of explaining things.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: He is decent. The class was once a week and he uploaded the lectures. Just do the work and you will be fine .

I took this class in my last semester before graduation, and it was the hardest class I have taken in my 4 years. For the summer class, you have 2 quizzes, 2 papers, and 2+ discussions each week. All tests are on lockdown & webcam, and he grades tough. This course was absolutely horrible. Oh and due dates are Wednesdays and SATURDAYS! Way too much.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--So many papers

comment: This course is mainly made up of discussions/quizzes/tests/mini-projects all due each week other than the tests being the midterm and final. The discussions get fairly lengthy as each week has about 1-3 due by the end of the week with one mini-project as well. Quizzes are 5 questions over a lengthy chapter (30-40 pages) but are do-able. Good luck!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I would definitely not recommend him for his online class. He has a ridiculous amount of busy work for a 16-week course. There's about 2 discussion posts a week, one project a week, 30-40 page reading with a quiz each week. Most of the work is just pointless. If you want a simple and low-key online class, I wouldn't take him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework

comment: Professor Gentry is a good teacher. He is very easy to work with. Just stay out of your phone during class  or you will lose point. He gives quiz review before midterm so that helps a lot. Just do the discussion posts and little projects and you will be fine. Best professor I took this semester
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Gentrys class is the easiest one to ever to exist. Show up to class, take notes, and get into your small groups for discussions. Truthfully, you only need the sourcebook dont get the other textbook he asks for we never used it. He gives you the questions and short answers that could potentially be in the midterm and final. Easy class.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Gentry is the best Hist professor! His class is excellent and it's not lecture heavy. Half the class is a lecture and the other half is a small group discussion with no more than three questions. SUPER EASY GRADING and I highly recommend. Says you need the textbook, but truthfully only need the sourcebook in order to complete the Homework
rating_tags: Hilarious--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: so. much. work. took as an online summer class and there were at least 4 discussion posts, 2 quizzes, and 2 projects per week. midterm and final were both lockdown browser and webcam. the work itself is easy there is just SO MUCH of it. especially for a gen ed!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: The class is lecture heavy, and there are a lot of graded assignments. Book is mandatory, but rather cheap. The group assignment book is the most necessary, lecture book is not. Attendance is mandatory. He seems to really care about his subject and is a generally nice guy.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Really enjoyed Gentry's class. One meeting per week is lecture, one is group discussion. There is quite a bit of reading between sources and the textbook, but it is manageable. Provides practice tests and study guides for midterm and final. Definitely would take again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Was a great professor. The class was lecture heavy overall, but he made them bearable for the most part. Thoroughly answers questions if anything needed further explanation. Generally has an assignment or discussion due every week, but easy to complete. Tests were part MC and part free-response and were pretty easy if you study a week or so.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He litterally gives you a list of terms at the start of ever class, talks about each on individually, and then gives you a slide with all the important bits of his lecture per term. it is so fantastic he is an amazing professor and is super nice, just don't forget to do the discussion posts!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: I took this class last semester and loved it. He is super thorough and understanding. There are variations of assignments that you do each week, but they aren't hard and are informative. Kahoot quizzes before tests and study guides that are almost exact copies of the test. I would take him again in a heartbeat!
rating_tags: Respected--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This is a capstone class and should not have been this bad. We read a book or 20+page article for every class and were then made to have open discussion. No participation resulted in a point off that grade even if you spoke in class, if it "did not contribute meaningfully to the discussion" it did not count. I also never got half the grades back.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Professor Gentry is an awesome professor who makes history much easier for students to understand. We had a weekly discussion posts, 3 exams, 2 short papers (that were easy and he literally walks you through), and in class discussions. The class was pretty enjoyable and his lectures are not as dry as most.
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--Would take again

comment: Great professor, makes it pretty easy 3 non cumulative tests. Gives you a great study guide, although it is a pretty thick study guide. Multiple choice essay tests. Weekly discussion posts. Come to class and easy B, and you will work again. Highly recommend taking him!
rating_tags: Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY--Would take again

comment: Professor Gentry is the best history professor I've had at KSU. He has 3 non-cumulative tests, weekly discussion posts, and 2 short papers. He gives you a study guide for the test that gives you all of the multiple choice questions and terms to know. As long as you come to class, take notes, and study it's an easy A. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Jon Gentry is a very thoughtful and caring professor who knows his stuff and knows how to teach (don't be fooled by his young age). He assigns a lot of papers, but it's a history class and he's preparing you for being a future historian. Lectures on Tuesdays and discussions on reading on Thursdays. Overall a pretty easy class if you put in the work
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I love Jonathan Gentry. He is very enthusiastic about history and he occasionally has a sense of humor. This course is very lecture heavy and reading heavy like most history classes. He gives really useful study guides for the tests but you have to complete it yourself. Pretty much, if you don't read or show up for the class, you're screwed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Fairly easy class, weekly online discussions, 1 essay, 2 or 3 tests, and a final. Weekly group discussions online as well as in class. Straight lecture, there's a powerpoint but it's mostly pictures. Take notes and the tests are very easy. Kahoot before the tests, whoever ends up in first place gets to exempt the test.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY
